website_summaries.verdict: This manual breast pump works well, is a compact and convenient size, and comes at a steal of a price.
pros: Reliably empties breasts more than even electric pumps
Is quick and easy to use, more convenient than electric pumps when looking to pump on-the-go
Does a good job catching milk from alternate breast when feeding baby on one side
cons: Device stains easily and needs to be washed often to prevent permanent stains

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time - my baby is 5 days old and couldn’t latch onto my engorged breast. Hand expressing in the shower did little to help, so I pulled out this manual breast pump and it was a game changer. I managed to collect nearly 2oz of milk within 15 minutes (in the back seat of the car on the way to his newborn appointment no less!), and after that my baby was able to latch on. I’m definitely excited to add this product into my every day routine at this point. No wonder it came so highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Looses Suction after awhile
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first but lost suction around 1 month of use. Now it doesn't stay on and I can't even get a drop of milk out. I only washed in warm soapy water, never put through dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: overall great product!
customer_reviews.text: this came in so handy at night during feedings when i was too lazy/tired to get out of bed and pump. It still allowed me to collect extra milk while baby was nursing in the comfort of my own bed! It's amazing how much milk it actually collects with natural suction. This is not a hand pump but just uses suction in conjunction with your natural let down of milk to collect extra. I started using it during the day as well i liked it so much. You'll be pleasantly surprised how much you get. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: tara

customer_reviews.title: Great product, price changes annoyed me..
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seems pretty awesome, I’m due soon and will update when using. I did auction it on and it had a very good suction and grip. The only thing that gets me is that I added this to my To Buy list a while ago and when I did the stopper was included, when I went to purchase the price changed and the stopper was no longer included in the basic package. I paid almost $14 for the basic without the stopper or pouch. The next few days it was down in price again WITH the stopper.. so that was annoying. Now for me to buy the stopper(for traveling) it’s almost $7..
customer_reviews.author: Heyystacy

customer_reviews.title: spilled milk is no fun
customer_reviews.text: I loved this at first, but after having used the product for a little under a month now, I'm quite disappointed. It's fallen off my breast more times than it's stayed on. I thought it was the suction at first so I contacted customer service who sent me a clip showing me a method to increase suction, which was helpful, but did not resolve the pump falling off. If I hold it in place, it catches all the milk, but it's inconvenient to have to do that. Without holding it in place, any slight movement tends to cause pump to fall off or if I stay still, the product holds about an ounce successfully then falls off my breast.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Lid is worthless, everything else is great
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the suction power and it saved a lot of lost milk. The only issue with suction I had was when I leaned forward and my stomach got in the way. The biggest issue and why I rated it lower was the lid for transportation and sanitation just kept coming off. I would put it on and it would instantly come off. There was no keeping it sanitized while out of the house. I use it mostly for night now when baby falls asleep after one breast and I'm too tired to get up to pump. It releaves enough pressure to fall back asleep and I don't have to worry about my production decreasing.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Puckett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but has a slight smell...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and a great value. Only complaint so far is, although I washed and sterilized this in hot water before use, it still has a slight plastic/chemical smell to it, even after a few weeks of use. For this reason, I do not store milk in the pump, rather in a glass jar in the fridge. I question whether this is 100% silicone because everything else in my kitchen that is silicone has absolutely no smell. I am guessing they must add something to it to give it the bendable quality it has? One star off for durability since it is recommended to replace every few months.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this pump.
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST baby product I have ever purchased. This allows the user to pump one breast while nursing baby on the other and is nothing like using an electric pump. This allows you to suction the pump on to your breast simply by squeezing the oblong bottom and provides a very light suction and a more natural way to catch milk that’s let down on the side baby isn’t nursing on. I used this early on to help increase supply by pumping the whole time baby was nursing and then around 8 weeks, simply to catch let down milk when baby was on the other side. This will be my standard mom gift for baby showers now.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Glasgow

customer_reviews.title: Its okay.
customer_reviews.text: Only get about a few drops out of this thing. I'm a 36DD. It pulls on my nipple when trying to place it for suctioning and it actually hurts a little. Kind of like a pinch. I've tried everything to position it comfortably. I try to leave it on for a while for the let down, but still poor suction. Otherwise, the product is made nicely. Overall, wouldn't recommend. Better off getting a manual breast pump where you have to squeeze the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I had heard great reviews about this suction pump to collect milk while nursing. Unfortunately, it did not work for me. After a couple of uses, the device did not suction well and kept falling off while I nursed my baby. They say not to cry over spilled milk, but I did. I was disappointed by the item. Not sure how it works for others, but have tried several ways to clean, dry, and use it as well as the skin but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: rajaghose

customer_reviews.title: A lot of crying over spilled milk
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to be able to give this 5 stars, because when it works it’s awesome. The issue I have is the suction. It doesn’t stay suctioned, especially after a while of use and cleaning, and I’ve had it fall off and spill milk so many times. I manually pump one side and catch on the other with this, but it’s getting to a point where the mess and hassle isn’t worth it. Maybe it’s my breast size (40D) or shape, but I’ve had this issue with multiple of these (I bought a second thinking maybe the first was just defective). I just wish this worked every time.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Stephens

customer_reviews.title: A must - have!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had had this with my first two babies! I tend to have over - supply but my body refuses to let down for a pump, which resulted in some really painful situations, lots of leaking, and lots of lost milk. While pregnant with my third a friend told me about this and I decided to give it a try. Best decision ever! So easy to use and I now actually have a supply built up in the freezer! I'll be getting these as baby shower gifts for friends- this is a mama must-have!
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Such an awesome product for any mom anywhere!! I wish I had this when my older daughter was nursing. I’ve built up a great freezer stash solely from using this on the opposite side while nursing. I will say, this is the second one I’ve gotten as my first one lost significant suction after less than 2.5 months. HOWEVER, I am using it and washing it daily so I’m not sure if that’s the reason. Overall great product and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kail Rhine

customer_reviews.title: Every mom should have this!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally write reviews but ... I just need to express how much I love this little thing. I honestly didn’t think I’d use it much since I already have an electric pump. I think I use this about the same amount. I love how small it is and it’s actually hands free. I walk all around the house with it while I do small chores. Or I use it in the car if I’m traveling somewhere and need to relieve pressure. It’s also very useful at night when the baby didn’t get the other side. It’s quiet so I don’t disturb her sleep. I love this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for nursing moms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after buying the Hakka as I wanted a second when the Hakka is full or if I need to use double when baby releases because my letdown is overactive. This is 100% equal to the Hakka though cheaper. The extra accessories plus free gift of reusable breast pads was a big plus and I love seeing companies trying to make their product stand out. I use this on one boob while baby is feeding on the other. In 10 days I’ve gotten 150 oz with this on a light suction on my opposite boob without pumping. I wish I had this with my first baby!
customer_reviews.author: J D

customer_reviews.title: Not a pump, just a leak catcher.
customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression that this was a manual breast pump but really it’s only design is to catch leaking milk. I bought this to pump while I am out since my newborn can’t keep up with my milk supply yet. The only way it kept getting milk was to increase the suction every couple minutes and you can only do that so many times before it start hurting. The suction was great and it was easy to put on, but not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Malia Harisis

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: EVERY BREASTFEEDING MOM MUST BUY! This is an absolute life saver! In 2 months, without ever actually pumping, I’ve built a stash well over 500 ounces. I just attach it on the opposite breast that I’m feeding baby from, and it collects 3ish ounces every single time. And it’s all milk that would have just gone into my breast pad and wasted! It’s so much easier to wash that a pump with 15 different pieces, and it is easy to pour into a bag. I’ve never had a problem with it coming off my breast, and it’s easy to travel with. You will absolutely not regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TheRaq

customer_reviews.title: Great for opposite side while nursing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this silicone pump! It's perfect for collecting on one side while nursing on the other. It can be tricky to keep in place of baby is a squirmer, but easy once you get the hang of it. It's soft so doesn't bother baby when it touches his leg while he's nursing. It felt comfortable on my breast after getting used to the suction. I found that it works best if used while nursing so I can take advantage of let down on the side not being nursed - it's not nearly as effective when used by itself without stimulating a let down.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great but it wasn’t for me. I’ve been used to pumping so the suction was not strong enough to drain my breast completely. I was only able to drain maybe 1-2 oz from each breast and there would be another 1-2 oz remaining in my breast that I ended up pumping. I could see using this as an emergency if you forgot your pump items to release some breastmilk. I’ll stick to my pump, don’t really want to end up with mastitis.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny28le

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT hold suction.
customer_reviews.text: Ok... I’m not sure what all you ladies are talking about! This thing is an absolute joke! It doesn’t stay put, loses suction constantly causing milk to spill. I tried multiple times thinking it was operator error but nope! Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity Grant

customer_reviews.title: Life saver and must have!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this product for any mom who has trouble pumping milk! My newborn despises formula and I am unable to pump for some reason. We are trying to get her used to a bottle but she only wanted breast milk. I bought this as a last resort to catch at least some milk. And it works! I've been getting almost 3 oz of milk Everytime I feed my baby! It also stops my shirts and rags from getting soaked from letdown. Now we have a fighting chance of getting her used to a bottle and eventually formula so I can have a break :)
customer_reviews.author: SDG Kofei

customer_reviews.title: A must have for breastfeeding
customer_reviews.text: I was initially skeptical for all these positive reviews, but this earns it 100%. I was hesitant at first as it looks like a big tick thing hanging off my breast, but the amount of milk it saves is amazing. I always have letdown in both breasts while feeding or pumping and I am shocked at how much this saves. I can even use it (carefully) while I feed her laying on my side in bed. It has easily become the best baby-shower gift I am giving to all my friends and family going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Lahr

customer_reviews.title: Constantly loses suction
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and does collect leaking milk, but mine loses suction typically halfway through a nursing session. This is even when I do the flip top method and squeeze higher for more suction. I just don’t like it because then it’s falling off my boob when it has milk in it.
customer_reviews.author: Courttort

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price point!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old is a great sleeper, which is awesome. The only tough part is that by morning I’m engorged and leaking. I love this Nature Bond pump because I can suction it on and it stays put while I brush my teeth, make the bed, whatever. It has a gentle amount of suction and catches the leaking milk, but I’m still able to nurse when babe is ready. This morning it caught 2 oz that would’ve otherwise been wasted in a pad. My lazy boob doesn’t leak as much, but I’ll probably get another one of these pumps , because at $14 it’s worth it to me to save every drop!
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It takes some getting used to because it definitely suctions on better than you think it will. Take the time to mess around with it the first few uses. You can adjust the suction n therefore the comfort but it takes a little practice. Its nice to catch those drops of liquid gold though that would have been lost in a pad. The 'lid' world great too. (The pink plug thing). My toddler grabbed it n shook it n I never lost a drop. Easy to clean and pour. Very impressed, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JCarey1006

customer_reviews.title: Collects mostly foremilk
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean, collects breastmilk that would’ve otherwise been lost on a pad or on my clothes. However for me at least, it collects mostly the watery foremilk that drips/is let down from the side my newborn isn’t nursing on. While it’s better than nothing, it’s not much of the fatty hindmilk that I’d like my baby to be full off of. I continue to freeze whatever is collected and will likely either add it to a full pump from when I start regularly pumping, or just use it as a backup..since it’s still liquid gold!
customer_reviews.author: jmd109

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing tool! I use this on the side I’m not nursing by baby and it catches the letdown. I call it my letdown pump. Some people may save the milk but I actually use it throughout the night during this first week of feeding to keep my breasts from being engorged. It has allowed me to keep my use of the electric pump to a minimum. This way my body is not getting the message to “produce more milk!” yet I can find relief from the discomfort of milk coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little time to get it placed and latched on just right. Also is quite a bit slow but this is all expected! Honestly this product became a lifesaver to me! I just had twins and I will admit 99% of the time we don't agree on latching. I am still waiting on an electric pump and my milk supply is diminishing! I bought this "pump" in hopes that it will help me cling onto what milk I still have (also latching babies too) while I wait for my real pump to get here and I will say that I am pleasantly surprised! I definitely would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Sticks out
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the idea of this BUT I cannot use it while breastfeeding because the baby just keeps kicking it off or I can’t have my baby in a comfortable position to use it. The football hold is the only way I could use it and that didn’t last long. It did however work great that way just not what I found to like. Maybe something that is more flat and out of the way would work better.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ziter

customer_reviews.title: Single handedly built my freezer stash
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this product. I saved SO MUCH MILK! I feel like 2/3 of my 200oz maternity leave freezer stash came from this little guy alone. When I went back to work I didn’t have to worry about if my boy would have enough. I will 100% be getting all of my friends one of these as they have their own babies. Some people will tell you that your baby is only getting “foremilk” if you buy this but do your research people. “Foremilk” and “Hindmilk” aren't a thing. You can massage your breasts to more evenly mix the fat/water before or while you’re using this and then you’ve even eliminated the gas problem that others have complained about.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Buying a second!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to breastfeeding and this product has been the best product I've purchased to ease the experience (which hasn't been easy for me). With this product, I'm able to catch about an ounce from the breast my baby is not latched to, which is a lot of milk in these early days. Without it, the milk would just be absorbed into my breast pad and wasted. I love this product so much that I'm buying a second so that I don't have to empty/wash the one I have as frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty22

customer_reviews.title: I wish I bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I’ve only used this twice but man I wish I had bought it sooner. So easy to get some milk “pumped” while nursing the baby. Much more comfortable than my electric pump and it involved little effort from me—currently using it and nursing while writing this review. I wish I had bought it when my little was born instead of waiting until now (he’s two months). He nursed all the time so I don’t want to allot more time to pump. This way I get best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah M.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday and I wish I would have ordered it SO much sooner! This is such a great product. I returned back to work this week and have been pumping while away from little one. I use the manual pump when I nurse and have been able to get over 10 oz a day just from catching letdown while nursing. It makes it so much easier then having to nurse and then pump and then clean all of the parts. I also keep it on my bedside table at night so that I can collect and not have to get up. I highly reccomend this manual pump!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before my baby was born, but for some reason didn't try it until she was about 5 weeks old. I'm kicking myself for not using it sooner!! It's super easy to use, and way more convenient than sitting around pumping after you've nursed. I get about the same amount of milk in here as I would with a 20 minute pumping session.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for breastfeeding moms
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for catching the milk that would have been lost otherwise. I wasn't sure this would work for me as I don't typically leak or get engorged; however, I've been about to get 0.5 oz - 1 oz each time I use it. I don't respond well to traditional electric pumps and only get about one ounce in a full pumping session anyway. This allows me to catch that much in half the time or less. This is very easy to wash. I would highly recommend this for any breastfeeding mom.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Lost suction in no time :(
customer_reviews.text: I received this pump on April 12, and as of today, April 24, I have to drop my 5 star review I would have given it, to 2. I have only hand-washed it, but the suction is horrible now. I have no idea why. It has helped me store bags of milk, which is amazing, but the fact that I can barely suction it on now is a huge disappointment. I just ordered the Haakaa brand pump so we will see if it holds up better. I wouldn’t recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna C.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I decided to buy this
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this pump. I use it in the mornings while I’m getting ready for work to collect a few ounces for my daughter’s bottles or if I’m feeling extra full but not feeding soon. I also use it occasionally while feeding on the other side. It is so simple, stays on, is easy to clean, and I have accidentally knocked it onto the floor a couple times and the stopper stayed in place. I wish I had this pump with my first daughter!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for nursing moms especially if you have an over supply!! I have this one and the Haakka and think this silicone is slighly softer and more pliable then Hakka making it more comfortable to wear. I believe they both work the same and have the same suction. I use this more frequently then my electric pump and have stored up hundreds of ounces using it. Wish it came in an 8oz version!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie E

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Buy Haakaa brand!
customer_reviews.text: Is not as good as haakaa. I’ve used haakaa for last 3 months and bought this so I wouldn’t have to pump. I’ve used it 6 times already and where my haakaa would pull 4+ oz this would only pull 1oz, and I have a heavy let down so it was only catching my let down. Also the material hurts! It would get stuck to my areola and it feels like pulling off a bandaid. I wanted to share my experience because I know people struggle with their supply and I hope to steer people away from wasting their time or money on things that don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: A. Macias

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I hate pumping with my Spectra...because it hurts, it takes too long, & there are so many parts to clean. This manual pump is so much more convenient, less painful, & definitely easier to clean. I use it to catch the let down on the other breast and have been able to suction out up to 2 oz. I love that it’s a steady suction rather than multiple sucks, so the milk just flows. I don’t use the stopper as I transfer to bottle right away. The lid doesn’t fit very well, so I don’t use that either. I am planning on buying another one so I can use on both breasts in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Great, genius product!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I am new to breastfeeding (36 days) and have had some engorgement, but not too much overproduction. This is perfect for when you are nursing on one side or one of your areolas is very sore and needs a break, but you still need to get milk out. You can feel suction, but it is not so hurtful. I haven't had to pump yet, but am able to fill up a 6 ounce bag in 2-3 feedings using this. Hope this is helpful to other moms!
customer_reviews.author: panda

customer_reviews.title: Not as Effective as I Was Hoping
customer_reviews.text: Even when I created the most suction this would allow, I only got a very slow drip. If I do breast compressions I can get a good stream, but it’s not very effective for emptying your milk ducts. I managed to get 2oz in 20 minutes, and with my electric pump I got 8oz in the same amount of time. Overall, this is handy when you’re breastfeeding so you don’t loose your foremilk when your letdown actives in the breast your not nursing from.
customer_reviews.author: MissNatalie

customer_reviews.title: Leaks...spilling that liquid gold
customer_reviews.text: I have used milk collectors before with my other kids but this is the first time I have used this brand. I gave it 3 stars due to the fact that the clear top leaks and my container has fallen over several times with the clear top on it and leaked golden liquid! The clear top does not fit whatsoever so now I have to use the pink one so I am glad it came with a 2nd top. However the suction works great and it’s very easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: nurseladerer

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!!
customer_reviews.text: While nursing on one side, you can pop this baby on the other boob and watch it flow! I love the fact that I can “pump” without all of the extra cords and having to dial up or down to get a good steady flow. This also allows me to walk around my home, and “pump” on the go. It’s super easy to use. COMFORTABLE and gets the job done!!! I was able to get an extra 2.5 oz out of each breast while feeding and after. Def worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm am surprised and happy today this thing is awesome! I dont have a huge supply so I try to catch every drop I can get. I'm used to using my pump and maybe getting an once or two extra in the morning and 1/2 ounces throughout the day after feeding. First use I got a whole ounce in the evening with no effort at all. I have larger breast so the pumps are hard to find a right fit. This fit perfectly and had no issue hanging on. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not normally a reviewer but this pump is amazing. I really was skeptical that it would work as well as the other reviews suggested. Worked amazing on the first use. I’ve been using it during the first morning feeding when we wake up. I attach it while my daughter is nursing and easily pump about two ounces while she’s nursing in the other boob. Normally all that would just leak through and soak up the breast pads. Very easy to use just flip the top over and squeeze and it just stays there no fuss, no worries if it’s gonna fall off. I’m very impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Katerina

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a BF momma!
customer_reviews.text: I am so super impressed with this pump! I couldn't believe how much I collected when nursing my son... And to think prior to having this, i wasted all that milk! The suction is awesome but if your little one squirms, be careful that it doesn't get knocked off. It's so super durable and cleaning it is actually easier than cleaning some bottles. I love that I'll likely never need to replace it during my year of breast feeding. Don't bother spending $20+ on a haakaa..this product is just as good and I got a free pair of nursing pads!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Titled pump but isnt
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have read the product description better it was titled as a pump. but honestly the only thing it's designed for is catching breast milk. Fun tip my doc taught me, when you are leaking from one side push down on your nipple for a couple of seconds and it will stop the flow until you're ready to pump that side so you don't waste milk.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: LIFESAVER FOR LOW PRODUCERS!
customer_reviews.text: This has saved so many precious ounces that I unfortunately do not produce easily! Normally I do not produce but about 3 ounces total every time I pump and that is from both side. This catcher gets 1 of those 3 each time! I can only imagine how much it saves for people who actually produce a lot! This will be my go to present for any of my friends who plan on breastfeeding! WORTH EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.author: Christa M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with items in picture...lid not leak-proof.
customer_reviews.text: You must read the description. The item does not come with the stopper nor does it come with the pouch. Also the lid that it comes with is not very leak-proof. Lays on their pretty nicely for protection as long as you keep it up right. But don't think you can travel with it in a diaper bag or turn it upside down. You'll lose all your milk. At least that's my experience. I tested it out and there are a lot of gaps in it.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Loving this! I would recommend to friends
customer_reviews.text: (in my opinion) this product is awesome. Its just whatbi needed. Easy to use and i was able to hide under my big puffy shirt and i can pump anywhere i go. However there is one thing i noticed, the silicone collects pet hair & lints. And those were like a static attracts to it and difficult to get off
customer_reviews.author: S. Carter

customer_reviews.title: If you are breastfeeding buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Not really a manual pump, more just milk collection but AMAZING! Wish i had this for my first three kids! Use on opposite side I nurse baby on and usually get .5-2oz. 2 weeks in and already have an extra 30oz stored without having to pump!!!! Also helps with engorgement pain, a must in the beginning of nursing!!
customer_reviews.author: Everything_BayGull

customer_reviews.title: More of a collection device than a pump
customer_reviews.text: This pump is less of a pump and more of a way to collect leaking milk. It is great to use on one side to collect your let down as you feed the baby on the other, but hand expressing would be more efficient than using this as a pump. It is dishwasher safe which I love but overall I’ve found this product pretty useless. I would purchase a manual pump with an actual pump if I were to do it over again.
customer_reviews.author: Mkane23

customer_reviews.title: Why did I buy this
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work as great as I had imagined. It's huge so it gets in the way when I'm nursing the baby in the other side. It's not really a "pump." It uses the suction to draw milk out but mostly foremilk and its nowhere close to what an electric pump can do. It's good for collecting but, like I said, it gets in the way if you're trying to collect while the other side is being used.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Godsend!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for engorged breasts. I can't believe I only discovered this after having my 3rd child. Great for collecting let down and milk from one side while baby feeds on the other. Exactly what I needed to help with engorgement. Only downside is that you have to stop and pour out the milk when the bottle is about 50-80% full. Stays on well but I do pay attention to it to make sure it doesn't fall off the breast. Will purchase a 2nd one!
customer_reviews.author: ATCDfambam

customer_reviews.title: Not great for manually expressing
customer_reviews.text: This pump is good for collecting the letdown while nursing on the other boob, but I do not recommend this for manually pumping. With my Willow pump I’ll be 4+ oz from each side in 10-15 min but with this it took 10 min to get about an ounce out (we’re trying to get our DD to take bottles and wanted to try with super fresh milk and I didn’t want to waste a milk bag for my pump). For what it is (way to collect the letdown on the other side), this works well, has good suction, and is easy to clean; it just wasn’t what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Anna C

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have a manual pump, so get one of these too.
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to decide between the Haafa manual pump and this one, the main difference in my opinion is that one pump is softer than the other. This pump is comprised of very flexible, soft silicone. The Haafa is a harder silicone. Depending on the breast, you might want to use both types. I like this one just as much as the Haafa pump. The packaging on this one is nicer, but all in all they both work.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Sad it didnt work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes and was so excited when I purchased this. Unfortunately it didnt work for me. The whole it's a pump thing is lies. It warped slightly after boiling. Didnt help me with my lazy boob at all. 😭 I wanted to give this such a great review. But it didn't do a thing for me. So sad about it.
customer_reviews.author: ZechMatMommy

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: Wow this product is amazing. I have not tried the other big brands that this silicone pump comes in but I’m positive that this one is just as good if not better for quality and price. It suctions well, stays on the breast, has worn well through cleaning the pump and everything. I love the pink stopper that it comes with because it is much more practical than the others that I have seen and love the bag for travel. It has saved me so much milk and so many tears. Will for sure recommend to all of my mama friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlynn Russell

customer_reviews.title: May not be as beneficial to pumping moms.
customer_reviews.text: A bit of a learning curve. Probably would work best while nursing to catch on the other breast. I brought it while I went out of town for business so I could relieve myself and not have to bring my pump. It took a long time and a long of manual massage to get milk out quicker, just too slow on its own. Didn't work for me but I can see how it would work for others.
customer_reviews.author: Christina K

customer_reviews.title: Truly a MUST HAVE for breastfeeding!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally I had wanted it as a drip cup for while I am breastfeeding. But this product is AMAZING! I've ALWAYS had problems breastfeeding. Using this product had increased my milk supply, relieved any engorging it caused, worked as a drip cup, and helped to breast feed in that when the suction cup was on one breast milking it- it caused milk to flow out the other nipple making breastfeeding really REALLY easy! I love it and truly wish I have had one with my other children whom were formula fed because of breastfeeding problems. Oh yeah...cons: It can get messy if it overflows, duh! And you will need a bottle brush to clean it out when ewie.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is really handy, if you’re not close to your electric pump, I should’ve had one of these with my other 2! The only thing I dislike is the lid/stand? Doesn’t stay on well. It would work better if the lid was silicone just like the catcher.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Washam

customer_reviews.title: A must have item! A easy hands free way to pump while feeding baby.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this item! It’s cheaper than the Haakaa and I like that it comes with the stopper and bag. This has been a huge win for me. I’m always so full after sleeping and this way I can attach the bulb to one breast and breastfeed on the other. It’s so nice to get that relief without having to sit there and pump when I get the baby down again. It also helps with a strong let down and easily builds up my breast milk stash. I’d highly recommend this product. A bunch of my gfs bought this and raved about it. I’m so glad I got one myself too.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C.

customer_reviews.title: Every Breastfeeding Mama Needs This
customer_reviews.text: I was annoyed with how much I leaked during feedings but it was still too early to use the electric pump (wasn't producing enough to justify cleaning and sterilizing). I asked my lactation consultant about it and she recommended this little doodad. I could not believe how effective it was (8oz/day!!). So easy to use. Just squeeze the bottom, stick it on, and sit back and relax. Hands free!
customer_reviews.author: BTV

customer_reviews.title: Really is 100% Spill Proof!
customer_reviews.text: My heart almost sank into my feet today - I dropped my Milk Saver with about 2.5 ounces in it on the floor (about a 3 foot fall) and expected milk to go everywhere. To my surprise, the pink stopper actually worked! Even with the fall and impact, that thing didn't budge and saved me tears and allowed me to store more milk for my baby. I love this thing so much, I bought two!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: GMe
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best thing I got for post-partum, after weeks of pumping with my conventional pump I was fed up and felt like all my time was spent either breast feeding, pumping, or cleaning pump parts. When I started using this pump WHILE breastfeeding I had so much time between feeds and the suction cup is so easy to clean and take with you where ever....a must for every nursing mom
customer_reviews.author: Katie Van Ornum

customer_reviews.title: Love this breast pump.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these (I ordered two) at the recommendation of a friend and was a little skeptical if they would work well or not. After just a few uses I am very impressed! I overproduce so have to pump a lot and these have helped make me not so dependent on my electric pump. They work best when you are feeding and having let down to catch any milk that would normally just get soaked up in a breast pad and for me help take away a lot of engorgment.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Good if you leak, not of you don't
customer_reviews.text: I wake up super full and thought this would be great to get milk from one side while my baby feeds from the other since she ends up spitting up if I let her drink both. It didn't work as well as I was hoping. It definitely has good suction and caught what little did leak out, but since I'm not a leaker, it wasn't enough to even save and I ended up having to put her on anyways. But I could definitely see it being great for the beginning when I did leak a lot, but for now, it just wasn't right for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and saved a lot of milk
customer_reviews.text: I used this a lot when my daughter was born in May. Now I don't use it as often as I did in the beginning as my milk settled down. It is easy to use and saved a lot of milk for me! I had no idea how much I've lost not using this product when my first child was born. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jinny Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Must have for breastfeeding Mommas!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a must have for breastfeeding mommas! I use it at every feeding on the opposite breast I am nursing from and in just 3 days (baby is 6 days old) I have collected over 20 oz! I am fortunate enough to be producing well but baby gets full off of one side and I do not want that liquid gold from the other going to waste so this has been the perfect solution! Having the stopper included is awesome you get everything you need in one kit! 10/10 recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Haley M

customer_reviews.title: Just get it!
customer_reviews.text: So simple and so affordable. We have a 3 month old and I regret not having this sooner for let down. My girl uses formula and breast milk, but I feel like this is already helping me increase my supply too. Put it on your registry and if you already have a baby just get it! The suction is so strong and it’s soooooo easy to clean. My husband literally came to tell me how easy it was to clean, we are so used to having a million parts but this is one and the wand just slides in there. It’s the best!
customer_reviews.author: mommabearclare

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for new moms
customer_reviews.text: This right here has been a life saver since having my son 11 days ago I’m able to store 15 oz. of milk per day just using this no pumping. I just wish it was a little large cause my morning feed I fill it before my son is finished so I have to stop go empty and start back. This is my second one, I got one as a baby shower gift and brought a second to leave in my diaper bag for on the go.
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: buy two, or better yet - naturebond, make a two pack deal!
customer_reviews.text: only bought one when I should have bought too. great for heavy leaking mammaries. very durable. almost every time I clean it I think I'm going to rip it but it's real tough. cleans great. overall good material and a quick solution for swollen, leaky glands. provides relief. not too uncomfortable to leave on for a while. wifey wishes I snagged a second one. I just might
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: ☆ A must have ☆
customer_reviews.text: Use it while baby is feeding on one side and it catches the milk on the other boob. Perfect for using in the shower as well. Easy to clean and store, throw it in your baby bag for when you don't have time to pump and you feel a let down coming on. I put it on when driving under my shirt you can't even tell.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Average.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in order to give my beloved haakaa a break and this does not even compare. I get maybe 1/3 of the milk I get with my haakaa with this brand. I was excited for the price because I received the stopper and cover. But honestly you get what you pay for. I’ll end up having to buy another haakaa and just use those pieces with it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you'll love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I wanted an easier way to pump one breast while my daughter fed on the other and this did the trick. I was amazed at how efficiently and quickly it worked. By the time she was done eating the other breast was emptied as well and no fumbling with multiple pump parts or needing to be near an outlet in the middle of the night. I've already recommend it to my pregnant and nursing friends.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed in this product. I originally was looking at the Hakka but chose something a bit more affordable. What I struggle with is that it falls off ALL the time and then there is milk spilt all over me or my couch. I’ve tried different tricks to try to keep it suctioned and it just won’t. The concept of it is great... durability is the product... not so great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time mom review
customer_reviews.text: Hi there! I must say the redesign on this is really nice. I had the first generation and it worked but after accidentally placing it in the dishwasher it seemed to loose its suction. So I ended up purchasing a new one! SO GLAD I DID- these things really are the best. Very handy and easy to use/position. The photo I added was from one side only and I had to empty my naturebond out twice. Bottom line: from a 2nd time mom addressing a 1st time mom...definitely have one of these handy when you are nursing your little one. It will help build your milk stash up very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy and Vi

customer_reviews.title: Great product for breastfeeding mamas!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product! It has helped me create a small stash without having to pump. I just suction this to the opposite breast whenever I’m nursing and it catches all of the letdown. I highly recommend it to all of the breastfeeding moms I know. The ONLY con I have found is that it sometimes loses some of the suction and you have to reattach it, but it’s usually very obvious when it starts to happen. Overall, I’m very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this product to use while at home. It’s easy to clean but you have to let it air dry for a bit to make sure there’s is no moisture still sitting on the inside. For when I’m out and about i use a more discrete milk catcher that fits in my bra. The only downside to this hakka is that the lid is very hard to keep on.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn Juliana

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have For Breastfeeding Moms
customer_reviews.text: I’m a first time mom and of course breastfeeding is completely new to me. This product was one of the highlights of the early days for me because once I knew how to use it, it was easy to use and allowed me to save usually up to 1.5 oz during each feeding. I will be highly recommending this to new moms who plan to breastfeed!
customer_reviews.author: HannahWI89

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction
customer_reviews.text: I have another brand of this collection device so I will compare the two. The nature bond feels firmer and has a much stronger suction. It stays on my boob better, but causes a bit of pinching. I could attribute that to the shape of my anatomy or sensitivity of my nipple. I recommend this product, but suggest you research to know what you are looking for! These devices have allowed me to build a significant stash during my maternity leave by passively collecting milk (1500 oz in 10 weeks ☺️) and kept me from being attached to both a newborn AND a pump!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for new moms!
customer_reviews.text: My only regret: not using it sooner!! While my baby nurses this amazing contraption collects the let down milk. I easily get one ounce each time! By the end of the day without any effort I've collected a full bottle for my baby giving my some time away and for daddy to help. I love this thing. Going to buy one for every friends baby shower!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I actually tried the Haakaa and this one seemed to be sturdier feeling and have better suction. Once my son was latched on one side, I could almost get a full feeding from the other side with this. It also helped relieve fullness easily when I was on the go and couldn't stop to pump.
customer_reviews.author: Stretchpants4life

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Love!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my hakaa! This is the second baby i use it with and it is one of the Best Buys! I absolutely recommend it! The other day i put it on while eating breakfast and was able to collect almost 2oz all while baby slept. I was also able to chase around my 2yo and no spills or loss of suction.
customer_reviews.author: alexevys matthaey

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not come with stopper!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a couple weeks back. I haven’t been able to use it for milk expression, but it’s great for catching letdown from the other breast. However I’m disappointed because it did not come with the pink stopper! I’ve spilled my white gold a couple of times. So now I empty it after every use, which is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Fatima S

customer_reviews.title: It was ok but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a product for breastfeeding moms with large breast or something like that. In order to release some pressure of the breast of something which in less than two months is under control when the flow is establish. For me it was a waste of money as soon as I bought the electric breastpumps.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria M. Jimenez Jourdain

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought this sooner! 1 month PP and i’ve been leaking and so engorged. I’ve been expressing and using breast pads to soak up the milk instead of having the haakaa and storing the excess milk. My body doesn’t respond well to pumping so it’s discouraging. I EBF my daughter but wanted to create a stash for when my husbands home from deployment and can feed / bond with her or date night. Started creating my stash on 1/18 and it’s 1/24 and I’ve already collected and froze over 60oz! I think this is a necessity for any BF mom!
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Best breastfeeding tool ive found
customer_reviews.text: This is the most important tool for breastfeeding that I have found. It helped me up my freezer stash. Like other reviews you have to flip the top back, squeeze, then apply it for it to properly suction. I put this on the side my 3 month old is not eating from. So much easier than getting out the whole pump after a feeding to build up the stash. Works best combined with hand expression as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: An absolute MUST!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a first time breat feeding mom and this thing is amazing!! My son was early so its taking me awhile to produce milk. When the baby is on the left breast, I attach this to the right and I get a great amount of excess milk. This is absolute gold to someone who is hardly producing milk. Now I can give my son the excess milk instead of supplementing with formula.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AMAZING. I save so much milk with it. It is sometimes tricky to suction onto me, but it works great. The silicone cover was confusing to put on it at first, but I figured out it doesn’t go on like a lid, it goes on like an upside down lid so it suction’s onto it. I don’t like how close up the 4 oz mark is to the top, because if it’s filled more than 2 oz it is hard to suction on.
customer_reviews.author: Kary

customer_reviews.title: Who knew about this product
customer_reviews.text: Great to catch milk that is expressing while I breastfeed my baby I leak so much and this catches 4oz at a time the suction power is awesome it hurts sometimes because I squeeze it to tight but it is great. I can catch the milk and pour it in a bottle for freezer stash for my baby later goes in my purse or baby bag and I can use it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny to save extra milk!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Easy to get on and off. It requires a few extra steps, which can be difficult with a newborn, but it’s totallt worth it to get 1-3 ounces of milk at each feeding that would otherwise be lost. In one month I’ve collected 200 extra ounces of breast milk from this alone.
customer_reviews.author: Natalya

customer_reviews.title: You didn’t know you needed this until you started breastfeeding and realized the other side leaks!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this little breast pump/ milk catcher! It has been such a milk saver!!! You simply suction it on the other side while nursing to catch all the let down and save it for later! I typically use it only once or twice a day during the morning feedings when my breast are the fullest, and will catch anywhere from 1 to 3 oz! Then put it in a bottle for her to have later at the sitter. It’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Denelle

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this product. Ive only had it for two days tho so Im hoping it is fairly durable tho it feels well made. As a mom breastfeeding her 3rd who has spend hundreds in pumps and attachments to try to make pumping work for me it just never did. This has worked and been so much easier I wish I had found this sooner I have a feeling its going to be a life changer for me and my little.
customer_reviews.author: A.Pristavec

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this and that it can be hands free. Unfortunately the suction on this particular product is not as good as other brands I have tried and I have found myself having to hold it in place at times for fear of losing that liquid gold. The lid that came with mine does not fit well so I cannot actually store any of the milk in it and am afraid to set it down after use for fear of it tipping over and spilling out the milk.
customer_reviews.author: Clair Sertdal

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Must-have product for every breastfeeding mama! I have bought 2 of these and have nothing but good things to say. I am able to collect much more milk with this and have a really good freezer stash because of it!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Less output than the 2018 model
customer_reviews.text: I have had great luck with the 2018 naturebond silicone pump so I was eagerly awaiting the arrival of the new model. Although it is more comfortable than the last model because the pour track has been removed, I also get much less output. I’ve tried it every way and went back to the old model, noticing an instant jump in output (so I know it’s not a fluke with supply). I’m bummed that they adjusted the suction with this one as opposed to just removing the pour spout. Hoping that they make the 2018 model available for purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! Problem solver
customer_reviews.text: I had to YouTube some videos to properly learn how to use it since the instructions are a bit vague. I love using it, it’s so easy to collect milk for supplementing. It has helped me to exclusively breastfeed since now I have extra expressed milk. It has also helped me increase my supply. Wish I had gotten it sooner. So worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Paulacg

customer_reviews.title: Breastfeeding Must have!
customer_reviews.text: The best pump I have! I saved so much breastmilk with this pump I had to buy another freezer it has good suction but watch out because if it gets to full it will fall off, it is easy to clean and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Unity martinez

product_meta.title: NatureBond Silicone Breastfeeding Manual Breast Pump Milk Saver Suction. New 2019 Basic Pack with Cover Lid in Hardcover Gift Box. BPA Free
feature_bullets: ★ Most Value for Money Basic Pack with Dust Cover Lid - Silicone Manual Breast Pump collects "let-down" / breast milk leaks and relieves engorgement using pure natural suction pressure. Every ounce of breast milk is precious. Save it for your baby.

★ Extremely Soft, Comfortable and Safe - High Quality Silicone breast pump. BPA Free and 100% Food Grade Silicone. Lab tested and certified by Bureau Veritas which is a World Leader in Testing, Inspection and Certification.
★ Air-Tight Vacuum Packaging, 1 x Dust Cover Lid,1 x Silicone Breast Pump. Basic Pack Does Not Comes With Silicone Pump Stopper And Velvet Pouch.

★ Easy to use, Lightweight and Portable - Hands-free and saves breastmilk on the other side during breastfeeding. Very Lightweight and Perfect for travelling. Hassle free and fits perfectly into any handbag or diaper bag.
★ Recommended by lactation nurses from Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital (USA). #1 Silicone Manual Breast Pump in USA, UK & Canada.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,484 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
